page.title: 06A Visit to the church
page.content: St. Kentigerns Church. Today we went to our church it is called St Kentigerns and was built in 1848.To replace an earlier one. We had a look around the inside of the church, there was the font, the bell ringing room, the viking grave stone there were plaques on the walls.There was an altar, a brass eagle lectern to hold the Bible there was the organ and a pulpit. We went to the tower in groups of six. I was in the first group to go up. The vicar took us up. There was me, Julie, Janette, Penny, Helen and Caroline. There are about 91 steps. The steps were wide but the staircase was very narrow. We stopped at the clock work part.The pendulum was massive.
